author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Friday said he will meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska next Friday, hosting the Russian leader in the U.S. for talks about ending the war with Ukraine. “The highly anticipated meeting between myself, as President of the United States of America, and President Vladimir Putin, of Russia, will take place...
title: Trump says he will meet Putin in Alaska on Friday

author: Caroline Vakil
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) said Friday they were moving forward with plans to hold a special election in November for voters to approve a ballot measure that would ultimately allow Democrats to pass a new House map ahead of 2026. "We have till Aug. 22. With the leadership behind me, they will get this...
title: Newsom says special election on California redistricting planned for November

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has unilaterally dissolved a collective bargaining agreement with members of the union that represents its workers, the union said Friday. “The Trump administration and EPA’s unlawful and authoritarian move to unilaterally strip EPA workers of their collective bargaining agreement and workplace rights is nothing short of an assault on our...
title: EPA dissolves union contract, AFGE says

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Meta Platforms settled a defamation lawsuit with Robby Starbuck, who claimed that Meta’s artificial intelligence (AI) falsely accused him of participating in the Jan. 6 Capitol riots.  There is no publicly available information on the details of the settlement except that Robby Starbuck, a conservative activist opposed to diversity, equity and inclusion efforts, will work...
title: Meta settles with conservative activist over AI chatbot lawsuit

author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment Energy & Environment   The Big Story  Trump cracks down on renewable energy The Trump administration is putting up a series of new barriers for renewable energy projects. © Illustration / Courtney Jones; Adobe Stock The moves are expected to create issues for the renewable energy industry, ones critics argue could...
title: Trump wages war on renewables

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: Click in for more news from The Hill {beacon} Health Care Health Care   The Big Story  Pharma industry loses on Medicare price negotiations   The pharmaceutical industry suffered a series of separate court losses this week, as companies and trade groups tried to fight Medicare drug price negotiation.  © AP Three separate federal courts...
title: Pharma industry loses on Medicare price negotiations

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A longtime shortage of a type of sterile intravenous saline is now resolved, the Food and Drug Administration announced Friday.  According to the FDA, sodium chloride 0.9% injection products have been in shortage since 2018. The shortage was exacerbated when Hurricane Helene flooded a Baxter manufacturing plant in Marion, N.C. last fall what was responsible for...
title: FDA says IV saline shortage is over

author: Amalia Huot-Marchand
description: Roland Mehrez Beainy, a co-owner of Trump Burger in Texas, is facing deportation. Beainy, a 28-year-old originally from Lebanon, entered the U.S. in 2019 with a non-immigrant visitor visa and overstayed, according to Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). The restaurateur was arrested by ICE on May 16 and placed in detention. He was then granted...
title: Owner of Trump-themed burger chain arrested by ICE, facing deportation

author: Julia Mueller
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton (R) has sued former Rep. Beto O’Rourke (D-Texas) and his political group, Powered by People, for unlawful fundraising activity after Democratic state House members fled the state to stall a GOP redistricting plan. “Democrat runaways are likely accepting Beto Bribes to underwrite their jet-setting sideshow in far-flung places and misleadingly...
title: Paxton sues O'Rourke in Texas redistricting battle

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: U.S. Ambassador to Israel Mike Huckabee on Friday lashed out against British Prime Minister Keir Starmer for urging leaders to deescalate conflict in the Gaza Strip.  “So Israel is expected to surrender to Hamas & feed them even though Israeli hostages are being starved? Did UK surrender to Nazis and drop food to them?” Huckabee wrote...
title: Huckabee lashes out at British leader over call for Gaza ceasefire

author: The Hill Staff
description: A group of Texas Democrats will give remarks from California on Friday, detailing their effort to fight what they have called unfair gerrymandering ahead of the 2026 midterm elections. The Democrats left the Lone Star State earlier this month to delay passage of a new congressional map that favors Republicans and offers the GOP an...
title: Watch live: Texas Dems give remarks from California amid redistricting battle

author: Jonathan Easley
description: The DOJ opened an investigation into New York Attorney General Letitia James {beacon} FEDERAL LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS are patrolling the streets of Washington, D.C., as President Trump ramps up his challenge to the District’s self-governance.   The new federal patrols, which went into effect at midnight, are led by the U.S. Park Police (USPP) and...
title: Trump versus the District of Columbia

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: A pair of sweeteners are being recalled nationwide due to a labeling mishap, according to the Food and Drug Administration (FDA).
title: Popular sweetener recalled nationwide as FDA warns of label mix-up

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Israel on Friday fired back at Germany over its decision to pause the shipment of arms for use in Gaza. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu spoke with the German Chancellor Friedrich Merz and directly “expressed his disappointment.” “Instead of supporting Israel's just war against Hamas, which carried out the most horrific attack against the Jewish people...
title: Israel fires back at Germany over arms embargo

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: The Trump administration plans to incinerate more than $9.7 million worth of U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID)-funded contraceptives that have been lying in a warehouse in Belgium since President Trump's order freezing foreign aid and shutting down USAID. The U.S. government is spending more than $160,000 to burn the mix of birth control pills,...
title: US plans to incinerate $9.7M in USAID contraceptives

author: Brett Samuels
description: Former Rep. Billy Long (R-Mo.) is being replaced as commissioner of the IRS less than two months after he was confirmed by the Senate, a White House official confirmed to The Hill. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent will lead the agency on an acting basis, the official confirmed. Long was confirmed in June in a 53-44...
title: Billy Long to depart as IRS commissioner

author: Phyllis Rabinowitz, opinion contributor
description: The Neonatal Care Transparency Act is a vital step in protecting children's lives, but it's part of a larger issue of 2,100 children dying annually in emergency rooms that are unprepared, and Congress must pass legislation requiring all hospitals to meet basic pediatric readiness standards.
title: A neonatal intensive care bill addresses part of the problem — but many children die in unprepared ERs

author: Jared Gans
description: Former South Carolina Lt. Gov. André Bauer (R) is suspending his Senate campaign that sought to primary Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-S.C.), saying he doesn’t want to further contribute to division in the country.  Bauer, in a Friday post on social platform X, said he didn’t make the decision lightly and entered the race with a...
title: Former South Carolina lieutenant governor suspends Senate campaign against Graham

author: Diana Fishbein, opinion contributor
description: This is not just an immigration issue; it is a test of our collective humanity.
title: ICE’s family separations are forcing children to parent themselves

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: The Justice Department asked two New York judges Friday to unseal grand jury exhibits related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, an expansion of its earlier ask to make five days of grand jury testimony public. The moves by Attorney General Pam Bondi to unseal grand jury evidence represent the Trump administration's supposed push to release the so-called...
title: DOJ moves to unseal Epstein, Maxwell grand jury exhibits

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump's former communications director Anthony Scaramucci on Friday said the Federal Reserve could reduce the interest rate following the onslaught of tariffs.  “I think the economy is weakening and you may even get a 50-basis-point cut from the Federal Reserve in September,” Scaramucci told MSNBC.  Trump has been urging Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell...
title: Scaramucci: 50-basis-point cut from Fed possible next month

author: Ryan Costello, opinion contributor
description: The IRS and CPAs must use AI responsibly and with caution, as it can be a powerful tool but should not replace professional judgment and oversight.
title: Taxpayers cannot risk automation without clear rules of the road

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Political pundit Karl Rove said both Democrats and Republicans face an uphill battle when it comes to redistricting, amid state regulations and contested campaigns.  “First of all, let’s admit there are gonna be consequences for both parties as a result of what is happening in Texas that neither party will like,” Rove said during a...
title: Rove: Both parties face 'consequences' in Texas redistricting battle

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The Justice Department (DOJ) has opened an investigation into the Office of New York Attorney General Letitia James (D), the state’s top prosecutor, who brought a successful civil fraud case against President Trump. The probe by federal prosecutors, launched by the U.S. Attorney’s Office for the Northern District of New York, issued two subpoenas this...
title: DOJ opens probe into New York AG Letitia James's office

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: California Lt. Gov. Eleni Kounalakis (D) dropped her bid Friday to replace term-limited Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) in next year's gubernatorial race, instead pivoting to run for treasurer in the Golden State. The announcement, which did not include an endorsement, narrows an expansive Democratic field. Early polling shows former California Rep. Katie Porter in the...
title: California lieutenant governor drops bid to succeed Newsom

author: Ellen Mitchell
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth may bring back the practice of several Army drill sergeants swarming and screaming at recruits during basic training in what is known as a “shark attack." The practice, used at the beginning of training to establish dominance, was largely ended five years ago. But Hegseth is now looking into having the...
title: Hegseth eyes lifting 'Shark Attack' training practice ban for Army recruits

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A left-leaning legal organization launched a lawsuit Friday that seeks to force the Trump administration to produce records over its recent handling of disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking case.  Democracy Forward Foundation’s suit asks a federal judge to expedite processing of the group’s Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests, which demand the Justice Department and FBI...
title: Left-leaning legal group sues DOJ, FBI for Epstein records

author: Zach Schonfeld
description: A federal appeals court panel voted 2-1 Friday to scrap a judge’s probable cause finding to hold Trump administration officials in criminal contempt for disobeying his order to turn around deportation flights ultimately destined for El Salvador. The U.S. Court of Appeals for the D.C. Circuit ruled the administration was entitled to an intervention because...
title: Appeals court scraps Boasberg’s contempt order against Trump officials

author: Emily Brooks
description: Rep. Byron Donalds (R-Fla.) is reintroducing a bill on Friday to assert congressional control over the District of Columbia’s sentencing policies. Dubbed the D. C. Criminal Reforms to Immediately Make Everyone Safe Act, or DC CRIMES Act, the bill would prohibit the District’s local officials from changing sentencing laws and restrict the ability of local...
title: Byron Donalds reintroduces DC crime bill to override local council amid Trump calls

author: Filip Timotija
description: Authorities in Washington seized two stolen firearms and illegal drugs, just hours after President Trump ordered federal law enforcement officers to patrol the streets of the nation’s capital over the next week. “Overnight, USPP officers and our federal partners collaborated to enforce EO 14252, Making the District of Columbia Safe and Beautiful,” The U.S. Park...
title: Stolen firearms, illegal drugs seized after Trump orders federal patrols in DC

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Nancy Mace (R-S.C.) accused a reporter of being a "raging Democrat" following a town hall event for her gubernatorial race on Thursday, after being asked about her vote against the Inflation Reduction Act passed under then-President Biden.   Mace at the event touted the construction of a new highway interchange for South Carolinians during...
title: Mace to fact-checking reporter: 'You're a raging Democrat'

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton (R) said in an interview on Friday that Democrats who refused to return to his state would “hopefully” be jailed. “I don't know, we're gonna -- we're definitely waiting to see if they show up,” Paxton said in an interview on “Fox & Friends First” on whether they would see Texas Democrats...
title: Paxton: Democrats who don't return to Texas 'hopefully' will be jailed

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump on Friday warned that a ruling against his sweeping tariff policy would trigger a depression similar to the great depression of the 1920s, warning that the country wouldn’t be able to recover. “ If a Radical Left Court ruled against us at this late date, in an attempt to bring down or disturb...
title: Trump warns that rulings against his tariff plan could trigger depression

author: Agustina Vergara Cid, opinion contributor
description: It is precisely because I love this country that I want to see more people thriving, producing, building a life here and making America freer, safer and more prosperous.
title: I just became an American citizen — don’t close the door behind me

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump has reportedly signed a directive for the Pentagon to start using military force against certain drug cartels that have been designated foreign terrorist organizations. The New York Times reported Trump signed the directive in secret, providing a justification for potential military operations against the criminal organizations. The Times reported that U.S. military officials...
title: Trump directs Pentagon to use military force against cartels: report

author: Ahmad Hashemi, opinion contributor
description: Beijing is proceeding cautiously due to several factors.
title: Iran shouldn’t count on China to boost its air force

author: Rep. Ashley Hinson (R-Iowa), opinion contributor
description: The "One Big Beautiful Bill" passed by Republicans under President Trump provides critical provisions to help parents afford childcare, including strengthening the Child and Dependent Care Tax Credit, expanding Dependent Care Assistance Plans, and raising the cap on employer-sponsored Dependent Care Assistance Plans.
title: President Trump’s leadership delivered historic childcare improvements

author: Laura Kelly
description: President Trump is putting infrastructure development and economic deals at the center of a peace deal between Azerbaijan and Armenia, as the administration pushes to achieve a historic truce in a decade’s long conflict in the south Caucuses.  Trump will host Armenia’s Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Azerbaijan's  President Ilham Aliyev for a signing ceremony...
title: White House: Infrastructure, economics at center of Trump Armenia-Azerbaijan peace deal

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan said Thursday he had “always operated within the highest legal and ethical standards” after President Trump demanded he resign, seemingly over Tan's alleged ties to China. “We are engaging with the Administration to address the matters that have been raised and ensure they have the facts,” the Intel chief said in...
title: Intel CEO defends himself after Trump attack

author: Aoibhinn Mc Bride | This Column was created by Jobbio
description: Summertime and the livin’ is easy? Not so for many American workers. That’s according to a new study by Headway, a self-improvement and learning app. Headway surveyed 2,000 full-time professionals across the U.S. to understand how the summer season affects work patterns, mental health, and workplace culture. Looking for a career refresh? Discover 5 jobs...
title: The great summer slowdown: Sun is out, burnout is in

author: Miriam Waldvogel
description: White House deputy chief of staff Stephen Miller on Thursday compared the nation’s capital to several foreign war zones, as the Trump administration readies plans to deploy an unspecified number of federal law enforcement to parts of the city. “It is more violent than Baghdad, it is more violent than parts of Ethiopia, and parts...
title: Stephen Miller: DC ‘more violent than Baghdad’

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The Department of Justice (DOJ) on Thursday upped the reward it's offering for information that leads to the arrest of Venezuela's President Nicolás Maduro to $50 million.  “He is one of the largest narco traffickers in the world and a threat to our national security. Therefore, we've doubled his reward to $50 million,” Attorney General...
title: DOJ doubles reward for arrest of Venezuela's Maduro to $50M

author: Emily Brooks
description: A court on Thursday declined to issue an immediate restraining order against Rep. Cory Mills (R-Fla.) requested by a woman who accused him of harassing and threatening her after their break-up, according to a court document reviewed by The Hill, but ordered both Mills and the woman to appear at a hearing later in the...
title: Judge sets hearing but denies immediate restraining order against GOP Rep. Cory Mills
